intro: Nemesia violiflora, commonly known as the violet flowered nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces clusters of small, fragrant blossoms. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Nemesia violiflora is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
